sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "

Suppose in the given figure, we have \(NO \parallel LM \). It is given that 
\[
	KN = 6 cm
\]
\[
	LN = 2 cm
\]
\[
	LM = 10 cm
\]
Now, write down the values of
\[
	\frac{KO }{OM }
\]
and
\[
	NO 
\]
\newline
tikzpicture{}
\newline

", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": " Since the line segment NO is parallel to side LM , we can write 
\[
	\frac{KO }{OM } = \frac{KN }{NL } = \frac{6 }{2 } = 3.0
\]"}, {"id": "s2", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
Now, in the triangles KNO and KLM we have 
\[
	\angle N = \angle L 
\]
and 
\[
	\angle O = \angle M 
\]"}, {"id": "s3", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": " 
So, we have
\[
	\Delta KNO \sim \Delta KLM 
\]"}, {"id": "s4", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{NO }{LM } = \frac{KN }{KL }
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{NO }{10 } = \frac{6 }{6 + 2 }
\]"}, {"id": "s5", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow NO = 7.5 cm
\]
\newline"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": [], "text": "$$\text{From Thales' Theorem, we can write $\frac{KO }{OM } = \frac{KN }{NL }$, which equals $\frac{6 }{2 } = 3.0$}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": "$$\text{Corresponding angles of a parallel line are equal, therefore, $\angle N = \angle L$ and $\angle O = \angle M$}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": " "}, {"data": [], "text": "$$\text{As ratios of corresponding sides of similar triangles is proportional, therefore, $\frac{NO }{LM } = \frac{KN }{KL }$, and after putting values we get $\frac{NO }{10 } = \frac{6 }{6 + 2 }$}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": "$$\text{Upon solving we get $NO = 7.5 $ cm. "}]
